headline: State needs to spend $106 million in federal funds on water, housing, other projects by end of year
summary: South Dakota faces a year-end deadline to spend $106 million in remaining ARPA funds or forfeit them, with key allocations for water infrastructure, housing, broadband, and emergency services. A critical state budget decision involves $64 million in unobligated state workforce housing loans, which Gov. Larry Rhoden proposes shifting to airport improvements while a legislative task force recommends property tax credits.

headline: What ICE is doing is abhorrent. But here’s why canceling the state contract to house its detainees might not be the right thing to do.
summary: Massachusetts anticipates $25 million from its ICE detention contract at Plymouth County Correctional Facility, creating a policy dilemma: cancelling could transfer detainees to distant for-profit prisons, while continuing means profiting from a system the author deems immoral; the proposed solution redirects all ICE revenue to immigrant legal defense and support services, using the agency's own funds to counter its policies while keeping detainees near family and counsel.

headline: Demócrata de Kansas City intenta insertar una disposición anti-ICE de ley
summary: Democratic Rep. Susan Ruiz attempted to amend Kansas House Bill 2204 to declare ICE has no jurisdiction in Kansas, citing the recent fatal shooting of former Kansas City resident Renee Good by an ICE agent in Minneapolis. Ruiz's amendment would have required ICE agents to be clearly identified and wear body cameras, and encouraged communities to declare ICE unwelcome. The amendment was ruled not germane by a rules committee. The underlying Republican bill, which prohibits international organizations like the UN and WHO from exercising authority in Kansas, passed the House 85-35 along party lines and now requires Senate approval.
